defs.def: a usually rectangular piece of stiff paper used to record information, etc:
examples: [countable]She showed her identification card and was let in.

defs.def: one of a set of cards with spots, etc., used in playing various games.
something useful in attaining an objective, likened to a high card in a game:
examples: [countable]I had one more card to play: my friendship with the president.

defs.def: a folded piece of thin cardboard printed with a message of holiday greeting, etc.
destined or certain to occur.
to be completely straightforward;
a machine for combing fibers, as of cotton or wool, before spinning.
to comb (fibers) with this machine.
Cardinal.
a usually rectangular piece of stiff paper, thin pasteboard, or plastic for various uses, as to write information on or printed as a means of identifying the holder:
examples: a 3ʺ × 5ʺ file card; a membership card.

defs.def: one of a set of thin pieces of cardboard with spots, figures, etc., used in playing various games;

examples: to win at cards.

defs.def: a piece of paper or thin cardboard, usually folded, printed with a message of holiday greeting, congratulations, or other sentiment, often with an illustration or decorations, for mailing to a person on an appropriate occasion.
something useful in attaining an objective, as a course of action or position of strength, comparable to a high card held in a game:
examples: If negotiation fails, we still have another card to play.

defs.def: postcard.
See
a program of the events at races, boxing matches, etc.
scorecard.
a menu or wine list.
See
See

examples: a queer card.

defs.def: or
examples: A reorganization is in the cards.

defs.def: to act cleverly, sensibly, or cautiously:
examples: If you play your cards right, you may get mentioned in her will.

defs.def: to be completely straightforward and open;
examples: He always believed in putting his cards on the table.

defs.def: to provide with a card.
to fasten on a card.
to write, list, etc., on cards.
to examine the identity card or papers of:
examples: The bartender was carding all youthful customers to be sure they were of legal drinking age.

defs.def: a machine for combing and paralleling fibers of cotton, flax, wool, etc., prior to spinning to remove short, undesirable fibers and produce a sliver.
a similar implement for raising the nap on cloth.
to dress (wool or the like) with a card.

to comb (fibers) with this machine.

examples: a 3ʺ × 5ʺ file card; a membership card.
